title: RuneTek

properties.name: description
properties.value: RuneTek is the game engine used for Old School RuneScape, which currently uses version 3 of RuneTek. The previous iteration, RuneTek 2, was used in RuneScape Classic. RuneTek 4 was the engine that was used after the HD update on what is now RuneScape 3, while the current version of that game uses RuneTek 7.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:RuneTek

RuneTek is the game engine used for Old School RuneScape, which currently uses version 3 of RuneTek. The previous iteration, RuneTek 2, was used in RuneScape Classic. RuneTek 4 was the engine that was used after the HD update on what is now RuneScape 3, while the current version of that game uses RuneTek 7.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
12 February 2015
(update)

Implemented a new engine feature to be used in future updates; made some tweaks to help resolve some uncommon technical issues.

20 February 2014
(update)
  • The combat stance system has been overhauled to make players less likely to get put in a Defensive stance unexpectedly when switching weapons or autocasting spells.
  • The game engine team has been making adjustments following last week's rewrite of mouse-clicking. So far they've fixed the bug it introduced whereby the left-click 'Deposit' option on bank deposit boxes didn't work.
13 February 2014
(update)

The game's click-interpretation system has been rewritten to try and improve its behaviour when clicking multiple items rapidly.

17 December 2013
(update | poll)

Routefinding calculations are now performed on the server, not the client. This especially improves the navigation for players trying to use melee against large monsters, as well as resolving numerous other navigation-related race conditions.

17 December 2013
(update)

The game client is now more responsive for players trying to equip lots of items quickly.
